name: StrikersVsGoalie
setup: Two striker agents try to score on a goal defended by a single goalie.
goal: Strikers aim to score; the goalie aims to block shots and prevent goals.

agents.description: Two strikers sharing one behavior and one goalie with a different behavior.

terms: Striker: +1.0 when the ball enters the goal.
Striker: small negative step reward to encourage quick play.
Goalie: -1.0 when a goal is scored.
Goalie: small positive existential reward each step.

behavior_parameters.vector_observation_space: Striker: forward and backward rays encoding ball, goal, and other agents; Goalie: 360-degree rays encoding the same objects.
behavior_parameters.actions: Both roles use 3 discrete branches for forward/backward, sideways, and rotation actions.
